title: Shift storefront theme toward a more blue, less pink/purple palette

requirements.text: Update the storefront visual theme to use more blue tones and reduce/remove pink/purple hues across the UI while keeping the existing playful/cartoonish aesthetic and ensuring good text contrast and readability.

quotes: Can you put a little more blue color, not pinkish? ... I wanted more manly color.

acceptanceCriteria: Global theme tokens are adjusted to emphasize blue as the primary and reduce/remove any pink/purple-leaning tones (including in light and dark mode variables).
No prominent UI elements (section gradients, buttons, cards, badges, dividers) render with clearly pink/purple styling unless it is a very subtle, non-dominant accent.
Text and interactive components maintain accessible contrast (no low-contrast text on gradients/backgrounds introduced by the palette change).

requirements.text: Replace any explicit Tailwind purple/pink gradient usages in storefront sections (e.g., featured collection cards) with blue-forward gradients that match the updated theme.

quotes: put a little more blue color, not pinkish

acceptanceCriteria: Featured collection cards and other gradient-based UI elements no longer use purple/pink Tailwind classes (e.g., purple-*, fuchsia-*, pink-*), and are updated to blue-forward equivalents.
The updated gradients look consistent with the rest of the site theme (header/hero/products sections) and do not introduce new clashing colors.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn components); only compose/override via theme tokens and app components.
Keep all user-facing text in English and do not add any derogatory or inflammatory language to the UI.
nonGoals: No new product features, filters, checkout changes, or backend changes.
No logo/image regeneration unless required by the palette change (not requested).

preferencesToAdd: Prefer a blue-forward color palette; reduce/remove pink/purple tones.
